verses.verse: Then <WG1161> drew near <WG1448> to him all <WG3956> the publicans <WG5057> and sinners <WG268> for to hear <WG191> him.
And the Pharisees <WG5330> and scribes <WG1122> murmured, <WG1234> saying, <WG3004> This <WG3778> man receives <WG4327> sinners, <WG268> and eats <WG4906> with them.
And he spoke <WG2036> this <WG5026> parable <WG3850> to them, saying, <WG3004>

What <WG5101> man <WG444> of you, having <WG2192> an hundred <WG1540> sheep, <WG4263> if he lose <WG622> one <WG1520> of them, does not leave <WG2641> the ninety <WG1768> and nine <WG1768> in the wilderness, <WG2048> and go <WG4198> after <WG1909> that which is lost, <WG622> until <WG2193> he find <WG2147> it?
And when he has found <WG2147> it, he lays <WG2007> it on <WG1909> his shoulders, <WG5606> rejoicing. <WG5463>

And when he comes <WG2064> home, <WG3624> he calls <WG4779> together <WG4779> his friends <WG5384> and neighbors, <WG1069> saying <WG3004> to them, Rejoice <WG4796> with me; for I have found <WG2147> my sheep <WG4263> which <WG3588> was lost. <WG622>

I say <WG3004> to you, that likewise <WG3779> joy <WG5479> shall be in heaven <WG3772> over <WG1909> one <WG1520> sinner <WG268> that repents, <WG3340> more than <WG2228> over <WG1909> ninety <WG1768> and nine <WG1768> just <WG1342> persons, which <WG3748> need <WG2192> <WG5532> no <WG3756> repentance. <WG3341>

Either <WG2228> what <WG5101> woman <WG1135> having <WG2192> ten <WG1176> pieces <WG1406> of silver, <WG1406> if <WG1437> she lose <WG622> one <WG3391> piece, <WG1406> does not light <WG681> a candle, <WG3088> and sweep <WG4563> the house, <WG3614> and seek <WG2212> diligently <WG1960> till <WG2193> she find <WG2147> it?

And when she has found <WG2147> it, she calls <WG4779> her friends <WG5384> and her neighbors <WG1069> together, <WG4779> saying, <WG3004> Rejoice <WG4796> with me; for I have found <WG2147> the piece <WG1406> which <WG3739> I had lost. <WG622>
Likewise, <WG3779> I say <WG3004> to you, there is joy <WG5479> in the presence <WG1799> of the angels <WG32> of God <WG2316> over <WG1909> one <WG1520> sinner <WG268> that repents. <WG3340>
And he said, <WG2036> A certain <WG5100> man <WG444> had <WG2192> two <WG1417> sons: <WG5207>

And the younger <WG3501> of them said <WG2036> to his father, <WG3962> Father, <WG3962> give <WG1325> me the portion <WG3313> of goods <WG3776> that falls <WG1911> to me. And he divided <WG1244> to them his living. <WG979>

And not many <WG4183> days <WG2250> after <WG3326> the younger <WG3501> son <WG5207> gathered <WG4863> all <WG537> together, <WG4863> and took <WG589> his journey <WG589> into <WG1519> a far <WG3117> country, <WG5561> and there <WG1563> wasted <WG1287> his substance <WG3776> with riotous <WG811> living. <WG2198>
And when he had spent <WG1159> all, <WG3956> there arose <WG1096> a mighty <WG2478> famine <WG3042> in that land; <WG5561> and he began <WG756> to be in want. <WG5302>
And he went <WG4198> and joined <WG2853> himself <WG1438> to a citizen <WG4177> of that country; <WG5561> and he sent <WG3992> him into <WG1519> his fields <WG68> to feed <WG1006> swine. <WG5519>
And he would fain <WG1937> have filled <WG1072> his belly <WG2836> with the husks <WG2769> that the swine <WG5519> did eat: <WG2068> and no <WG3762> man <WG3762> gave <WG1325> to him.

And when he came <WG2064> to himself, <WG1438> he said, <WG2036> How <WG4214> many <WG4214> hired <WG3407> servants <WG3407> of my father's <WG3962> have bread <WG740> enough <WG4052> and to spare, <WG4052> and I perish <WG622> with hunger! <WG3042>
I will arise <WG450> and go <WG4198> to my father, <WG3962> and will say <WG2046> to him, Father, <WG3962> I have sinned <WG264> against <WG1519> heaven, <WG3772> and before <WG1799> you,
And am <WG1510> no <WG3765> more <WG3765> worthy <WG514> to be called <WG2564> your son: <WG5207> make <WG4160> me as one <WG1520> of your hired <WG3407> servants. <WG3407>

And he arose, <WG450> and came <WG2064> to his father. <WG3962> But when he was yet <WG2089> a great <WG3112> way <WG3112> off, <WG568> his father <WG3962> saw <WG1492> him, and had compassion, <WG4697> and ran, <WG5143> and fell <WG1968> on <WG1909> his neck, <WG5137> and kissed <WG2705> him.

And the son <WG5207> said <WG2036> to him, Father, <WG3962> I have sinned <WG264> against <WG1519> heaven, <WG3772> and in your sight, <WG1799> and am <WG1510> no <WG3765> more <WG3765> worthy <WG514> to be called <WG2564> your son. <WG5207>

But the father <WG3962> said <WG2036> to his servants, <WG1401> Bring <WG1627> forth <WG1627> the best <WG4413> robe, <WG4749> and put <WG1746> it on <WG1746> him; and put <WG1325> a ring <WG1146> on <WG1519> his hand, <WG5495> and shoes <WG5266> on <WG1519> his feet: <WG4228>
And bring <WG5342> here <WG5602> the fatted <WG4618> calf, <WG3448> and kill <WG2380> it; and let us eat, <WG5315> and be merry: <WG2165>
For this <WG3778> my son <WG5207> was dead, <WG3498> and is alive <WG326> again; <WG326> he was lost, <WG622> and is found. <WG2147> And they began <WG756> to be merry. <WG2165>
Now <WG1161> his elder <WG4245> son <WG5207> was in the field: <WG68> and as he came <WG2064> and drew near <WG1448> to the house, <WG3614> he heard <WG191> music <WG4858> and dancing. <WG5525>
And he called <WG4341> one <WG1520> of the servants, <WG3816> and asked <WG4441> what <WG5101> these <WG5023> things meant. <WG1498>

And he said <WG2036> to him, Your brother <WG80> is come; <WG2240> and your father <WG3962> has killed <WG2380> the fatted <WG4618> calf, <WG3448> because <WG3754> he has received <WG618> him safe <WG5198> and sound. <WG5198>
And he was angry, <WG3710> and would <WG2309> not go <WG1525> in: therefore <WG3767> came <WG1831> his father <WG3962> out, and entreated <WG3870> him.

And he answering <WG611> said <WG2036> to his father, <WG3962> See, <WG2400> these <WG5118> many <WG5118> years <WG2094> do I serve <WG1398> you, neither <WG3763> transgressed <WG3928> I at <WG3763> any <WG3763> time your commandment: <WG1785> and yet you never <WG3763> gave <WG1325> me a kid, <WG2056> that I might make <WG2165> merry <WG2165> with my friends: <WG5384>

But as soon <WG3753> as this <WG3778> your son <WG5207> was come, <WG2064> which <WG3588> has devoured <WG2719> your living <WG979> with harlots, <WG4204> you have killed <WG2380> for him the fatted <WG4618> calf. <WG3448>
And he said <WG2036> to him, Son, <WG5043> you are <WG1488> ever <WG3842> with me, and all <WG3956> that I have <WG1699> is yours. <WG4674>

It was meet <WG1163> that we should make <WG2165> merry, <WG2165> and be glad: <WG5463> for this <WG3778> your brother <WG80> was dead, <WG3498> and is alive <WG326> again; <WG326> and was lost, <WG622> and is found. <WG2147>
